page.title: 01HENHAM,WANGFORD INTRODUCTION
page.content: Our school is called Henham School It is 100 yrs. old and has 40 pupils. Henham is not really a village anymore .It is just a few isolated cottages in the country near to Wangford.A long time ago there would have been more houses and people who worked on the estates of the Lords of Stradbroke. Wangford is now the village where most of the children who go to our school live.A really busy road called the A12 goes past our school -it goes from Yarmouth to London Henham Park is a lovely big estate owned by Lord Stradbroke and it is right across the road from our school.Before the old Earl died (about 2yrs. ago) people could walk round the park free.The new Lord is called Keith and he has got lots of new ideas of what to do with the Park not everybody likes them. There is a Sunday Market in the park
